snippet: A writer who heals injured birds blogs on a controversial incident in Utah.
abstract: A writer who heals injured birds blogs on a controversial incident in Utah.
lead_paragraph: Suzie Gilbert, a friend and neighbor, has for many years been a hard-working bird rehabilitator, a career described beautifully in her recent book "Flyaway." She also recently launched a blog, The Crooked Wing, and alerted me to a post on a remarkable occurrence last month in Utah, when thousands of migrating eared grebes, evidently disoriented by a storm, began crash landing on roads, parking lots and the like -- surfaces they apparently mistook for water. They can only take flight from water, making such landings a death sentence for those that survived the impact.

headline.main: Other Voices: The Night it Snowed Grebes in Utah
